Jersey_City.Van Vorst House:
The Van Vorst House is a colonial-era residence in Jersey City, New Jersey, USA, located on Palisade Avenue in The Heights. The stone house was built c.1740–1742 by descendants of the first settlers in the region. It is one of the oldest building in Jersey City
The Van Vorsts were a prominent family who trace their North American roots the third superintendent of the patroonship Pavonia, whose bowery was located at Harsimus, where his widow built the first stone house in the colony on the shores of the North River (Hudson River) in 1647.
